Email Conversation Export
=========================
Export Date: 2025-09-26 12:10:29
Folder: CYIUPDK - ksa insurance - renewal outcome
Message Count: 3

--------------------------------------------------
ID: CYIUPDK_00
From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
To: Joe Hobeika <Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>
CC: 
BCC: 
Date: 2024-09-24 16:45
Subject: KSA Insurance - Renewal Outcome
--------------------------------------------------
Hi Joe,

 

Just want to provide an update on the insurance renewal for KSA. 

 

After several rounds of negotiation in a very short span of time, we’ve secured the acceptable terms for the renewal for the KSA insurance policies. Below is a summary of the key points:

 

Summary of Offers & Responses:

Offer

Premium

Deductible & Conditions

Status

Base

SAR 2.4M

SAR 20K for stock losses (store/warehouse)

Expiring Term

1st Offer

SAR 3M

25% premium increase (SAR 600K)

Rejected

2nd Offer

SAR 2.76M

15% premium increase (SAR 360K) – increased deductible to SAR 50K

Rejected

3rd Offer

SAR 2.4M

No premium increase - SAR 50K deductible – Fresh 3 Year Agreement 

Rejected

Our Counterproposal

SAR 2.4M

No premium increase - SAR 35K deductible - No LTA requirement

Accepted

 

Key Points:

*	Premium Held: We avoided any increase, keeping the premium at SAR 2.4M.
*	Deductible Adjusted: Increased to SAR 35K for store/warehouse stock losses (originally SAR 20K). This is still below the SAMA minimum (SAR 50K for stores, SAR 500K for warehouses).
*	No Long-Term Agreement: We rejected the request for a new 3-year Long-Term Agreement LTA, as we will be running a full tender for the group policies the coming year.

*	No Long-Term Agreement: We rejected the request for a new 3-year Long-Term Agreement LTA, as we will be running a full tender for the group policies the coming year.

 

Next year, when running the full tender, we can potentially revert the deductible back to SAR 20K or maybe even lower. 

 

Conclusion:

We’ve secured no premium increase, a modest deductible increase, and no long-term commitment. This outcome positions us well for next year’s tender.

 

I’ve already confirmed the terms, and KSA Admin and Finance are aware and copied on the communication. Full correspondence is attached for your reference.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​	
SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION	
M.C.T. FZE	
DUBAI	
‑	
UNITED ARAB EMIRATES	
+971 4 8045000

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
Date: Tuesday, 24 September 2024 at 4:45 PM
To: Joe Hobeika <Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com>
Subject: KSA Insurance - Renewal Outcome

Hi Joe,

 

Just want to provide an update on the insurance renewal for KSA. 

 

After several rounds of negotiation in a very short span of time, we’ve secured the acceptable terms for the renewal for the KSA insurance policies. Below is a summary of the key points:

 

Summary of Offers & Responses:

Offer

Premium

Deductible & Conditions

Status

Base

SAR 2.4M

SAR 20K for stock losses (store/warehouse)

Expiring Term

1st Offer

SAR 3M

25% premium increase (SAR 600K)

Rejected

2nd Offer

SAR 2.76M

15% premium increase (SAR 360K) – increased deductible to SAR 50K

Rejected

3rd Offer

SAR 2.4M

No premium increase - SAR 50K deductible – Fresh 3 Year Agreement 

Rejected

Our Counterproposal

SAR 2.4M

No premium increase - SAR 35K deductible - No LTA requirement

Accepted

 

Key Points:

*	Premium Held: We avoided any increase, keeping the premium at SAR 2.4M.
*	Deductible Adjusted: Increased to SAR 35K for store/warehouse stock losses (originally SAR 20K). This is still below the SAMA minimum (SAR 50K for stores, SAR 500K for warehouses).
*	No Long-Term Agreement: We rejected the request for a new 3-year Long-Term Agreement LTA, as we will be running a full tender for the group policies the coming year.

*	No Long-Term Agreement: We rejected the request for a new 3-year Long-Term Agreement LTA, as we will be running a full tender for the group policies the coming year.

 

Next year, when running the full tender, we can potentially revert the deductible back to SAR 20K or maybe even lower. 

 

Conclusion:

We’ve secured no premium increase, a modest deductible increase, and no long-term commitment. This outcome positions us well for next year’s tender.

 

I’ve already confirmed the terms, and KSA Admin and Finance are aware and copied on the communication. Full correspondence is attached for your reference.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop

HAGOP GHAZARIAN​​​​

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 8045000

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Date: Tuesday, 24 September 2024 at 4:45 PM
To: Joe Hobeika <Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com <mailto:Joe.Hobeika@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: KSA Insurance - Renewal Outcome

Hi Joe,

 

Just want to provide an update on the insurance renewal for KSA. 

 

After several rounds of negotiation in a very short span of time, we’ve secured the acceptable terms for the renewal for the KSA insurance policies. Below is a summary of the key points:

Below is a summary of the key points:

 

Summary of Offers & Responses:

Offer

Premium

Deductible & Conditions

Status

Base

SAR 2.4M

SAR 20K for stock losses (store/warehouse)

Expiring Term

1st Offer

SAR 3M

25% premium increase (SAR 600K)

Rejected

2nd Offer

SAR 2.76M

15% premium increase (SAR 360K) – increased deductible to SAR 50K

Rejected

3rd Offer

SAR 2.4M

No premium increase - SAR 50K deductible – Fresh 3 Year Agreement 

Rejected

Our Counterproposal

SAR 2.4M

No premium increase - SAR 35K deductible - No LTA requirement

Accepted

 

Key Points:

*	Premium Held: We avoided any increase, keeping the premium at SAR 2.4M.
*	Deductible Adjusted: Increased to SAR 35K for store/warehouse stock losses (originally SAR 20K). This is still below the SAMA minimum (SAR 50K for stores, SAR 500K for warehouses).
*	No Long-Term Agreement: We rejected the request for a new 3-year Long-Term Agreement LTA, as we will be running a full tender for the group policies the coming year.

 

Next year, when running the full tender, we can potentially revert the deductible back to SAR 20K or maybe even lower. 

 

Conclusion:

We’ve secured no premium increase, a modest deductible increase, and no long-term commitment. This outcome positions us well for next year’s tender.

 

I’ve already confirmed the terms, and KSA Admin and Finance are aware and copied on the communication. Full correspondence is attached for your reference.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop
